groups.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing
groups.description: Tracing options for Woody HTTP Bridge.

groups.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints
groups.description: Endpoints to which Woody tracing should be applied.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.enabled
properties.description: Whether the Woody HTTP Bridge servlet filter should be registered.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints
properties.description: List of endpoint policies describing how tracing headers are processed.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints[].port
properties.description: Local server port to which the policy applies.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints[].path
properties.description: Request path prefix that should match the incoming request.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints[].request-header-mode
properties.description: How incoming tracing hints are handled: OFF | WOODY_OR_X_WOODY | CIPHER_TOKEN_EXPERIMENTAL | VAULT_TOKEN_EXPERIMENTAL.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints[].response-header-mode
properties.description: Which tracing headers are written on responses: OFF | WOODY | X_WOODY | HTTP.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints[].propagate-errors
properties.description: When true, exceptions are rethrown to the caller instead of being converted to Woody error responses.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints[].default-cipher-token
properties.description: Optional inline cipher secret to decrypt tracing tokens when Vault is not used.

properties.name: woody-http-bridge.tracing.endpoints[].token-ttl
properties.description: Optional token TTL in minutes used to validate decrypted tokens.
